If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Done quick code review (on other commits as well), seems ok, I will test more deeply later this week. Very excited about this.
utACK 2c3eade704f63b360926de9e975ce80143781679 (Only checked that this does't affect linux)
OK. But I'll wait for gitian build done.
This is already be defined only if WIN32. Forgot about this
Drop this because this convert between UTF-8 and UCS-2, not UTF-16. Use std::codecvt_utf8_utf16 instead.

> Drop this because this convert between UTF-8 and UCS-2, not UTF-16. Use std::codecvt_utf8_utf16 instead.\n\nThis is documented at https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_68_0/boost/detail/utf8_codecvt_facet.hpp, in case anybody else is curious.
doesn't this break support for non-UTF8 path locales on UNIX?\n(that's why this code was how it was, AFAIK)
that utf8 is unused on other platform than Windows\nhttps://github.com/boostorg/filesystem/blob/16821f7903f02d0bb6bb2ef2503ea41559c6bdf1/include/boost/filesystem/path.hpp#L411-455
strangeâ€¦\n(I don't think it was added for windows back in the day, but I might be misremembering)
